API docs by Redocly

3Commas API (DCA Bot) (1.0.0)

Download OpenAPI specification:

Endpoints to create and manage DCA Bots on 3Commas.

Market Data

The Market data section provides access to various endpoints that deliver essential information about cryptocurrency exchanges, trading pairs, and market rules. This data is crucial for understanding the available markets and their specific conditions.

Market data endpoints show:

  • Exchange details: Including supported trading pairs and available assets
  • Trading rules: Such as minimum and maximum order sizes, and other market restrictions
  • Current market conditions: Including current Bid, Ask and Last price

3Commas allows users to retrieve comprehensive market data through these endpoints, ensuring up-to-date and accurate information for effective trading strategies.

Supported markets list

Returns the list of markets supported by 3Commas.

Responses

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/accounts/market_list

All market pairs

The method allows getting the list of pairs supported by the exchange in 3Commas format.

query Parameters
market_code
required
string
Example: market_code=binance_us

Unique exchange code in the 3Commas system. Use the “Supported markets list” endpoint to get valid values.

Currency rates and limits

The method returns the current trading rules and ticker information on exchange.

query Parameters
market_code
required
integer

Unique exchange code in the 3Commas system. Use endpoint Supported markets list to get value for parameter market_code.

pair
required
string

Trading pair in 3Commas format. Use endpoints All Market Pairs to get value for parameter pair in 3Commas format.

limit_type
string
Enum: "bot" "smart_trade"

Defines the type of trading limits returned based on the selected trading tool bot or smart_trade. If set to bot, the response includes trading limits specific to DCA, Signal and Grid Bots. If set to smart_trade, the response includes trading limits for SmartTrade.

Responses

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/accounts/currency_rates

DCA Bot

The DCA Bot allows users to automate trading on the exchange by following a Dollar Cost Averaging strategy.

DCA Bot entity contains a set of parameters and conditions that manage deals. 3Commas provides methods to create and manage DCA Bot entities and their associated deals.

Each DCA Bot entity holds information, including:

  • Exchange account and trading pairs
  • Strategy configuration and active deals
  • Take Profit and Stop Loss settings
  • Safety Orders configuration for risk management
  • Trading cooldowns and limits

The process starts with configuring a DCA Bot, where all trading conditions, such as base and safety orders, take profit, and stop loss, are set. The bot automatically creates and manages deals based on the configured strategy.

Available strategy list

Returns available strategy list for DCA Bot. Use the query parameters to page through results.

Authorizations:
SIGNED
query Parameters
account_id
integer

Unique 3Commas ID of the exchange account entity. Use the List of connected exchanges and wallets endpoint to retrieve the value for the account_id parameter.

type
string
Enum: "long" "short"

Specifies the strategy direction for the bot.

strategy
string
Enum: "simple" "composite"

Specifies the type of strategy list.

Responses

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/bots/strategy_list

Create DCA Bot

Creates a new DCA Bot

Authorizations:
APIKEY
Request Body schema: application/json
required

Bot configuration payload

name
string [ 1 .. 200 ] characters

User-defined name of the DCA Bot. If not specified, the system will generate a default name automatically.

account_id
required
integer

ID of the exchange account entity where you want to create the DCA Bot.

pairs
required
Array of strings (Pairs)

Trading pair(s) in 3Commas format.

max_active_deals
integer [ 1 .. 199 ]
Default: 1

The maximum number of active deals available for this DCA Bot.

strategy
string
Enum: "short" "long"

The type of trading strategy used by this DCA Bot.

profit_currency
string
Enum: "base_currency" "quote_currency"

Currency used for profit calculation: base_currency or quote_currency.

base_order_volume_type
string
Enum: "quote_currency" "base_currency" "percent"

The volume type of the base order.

base_order_volume
string

The volume of the base order for this DCA Bot.

start_order_type
string
Enum: "limit" "market"

The start order type for this DCA Bot.

Array of objects (StrategyConfig)

Array of strategies specifically for opening deals.

leverage_type
string
Enum: "cross" "isolated"

Sets leverage settings for a futures account.

leverage_custom_value
number

Leverage value (exchange- and pair-dependent).

trailing_enabled
boolean

Enables trailing for Take Profit.

trailing_deviation
string

Percentage value of the trailing deviation.

take_profit_type
string
Enum: "base" "total"

Basis for Take Profit calculation.

take_profit
string

Percentage value for the bot’s Take Profit. Set to 0 if using steps.

Array of objects (TakeProfitStep)

Take Profit steps (up to 4), each with:

  • amount_percentage
  • profit_percentage
Array of objects (StrategyConfig)

Array of strategies used for closing deals.

min_profit_type
string
Enum: "base_order_volume" "total_bought_volume"

Basis for minimum profit calculation.

min_profit_percentage
string

Minimum profit percentage required to complete a deal.

reinvesting_percentage
string [ 0 .. 100 ]

Percentage of realized profit to reinvest in each new deal.

stop_loss_percentage
string

Percentage drop to trigger Stop Loss.

stop_loss_type
string
Enum: "stop_loss" "stop_loss_and_disable_bot"

Action after Stop Loss closes a deal.

tsl_enabled
boolean

Enables trailing for Stop Loss.

sl_to_breakeven_enabled
boolean
Default: false

Enables the Move-to-Breakeven feature.

sl_to_breakeven_data
object

Configuration for breakeven trigger levels (0 = entry price, 1 = first TP step, etc.).

stop_loss_timeout_enabled
boolean
Default: false

Enables Stop Loss timeout.

stop_loss_timeout_in_seconds
integer

Timeout duration in seconds for Stop Loss.

risk_reduction_percentage
string

Percentage of losses to reduce base and safety orders proportionally.

safety_order_step_percentage
string

Price deviation (%) to open each safety order.

safety_order_volume_type
string
Enum: "quote_currency" "base_currency" "percent"

Volume type for safety orders.

safety_order_volume
string

Volume of each safety order.

Array of objects (StrategyConfig)

Array of strategies for executing safety orders.

max_safety_orders
integer [ 0 .. 200 ]

Maximum total number of safety orders per deal.

active_safety_orders_count
integer

Number of safety orders the bot may place concurrently.

martingale_volume_coefficient
string [ 0.1 .. 10 ]

Multiplier for increasing safety order volume (Martingale).

martingale_step_coefficient
string [ 0.1 .. 10 ]

Multiplier for increasing safety order step (Martingale).

min_volume_btc_24h
string

Minimum 24h BTC volume required to open a deal.

min_price
number

Minimum price to open a new deal.

max_price
number

Maximum price to open a new deal.

deal_start_delay_seconds
integer

Delay before a new deal starts (seconds).

cooldown
string [ 0 .. 2592000 ]

Time after closing a deal before a new one can start (seconds).

disable_after_deals_count
integer

Number of deals after which the bot disables itself.

allowed_deals_on_same_pair
integer

Max concurrent deals on the same pair (MultiBot only).

min_price_percentage
number [ -95 .. 1000 ]

Minimum entry price percentage (−95 to 1000).

max_price_percentage
number [ -95 .. 1000 ]

Maximum entry price percentage (−95 to 1000).

close_deals_timeout
string >= 60

Auto-close deals after this many seconds.

Responses

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/bots/create_bot

  • "finished_deals_count": "string",
  • "funds_locked_in_active_deals": "string",
  • "btc_funds_locked_in_active_deals": "string",
  • "active_deals_usd_profit": "string",
  • "active_deals_btc_profit": "string",
  • "reinvested_volume_usd": 0

Edit DCA Bot

Edits an existing DCA Bot by its ID.

Authorizations:
SIGNED
path Parameters
bot_id
required
integer

Unique 3Commas ID for this DCA Bot entity.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
name
string [ 1 .. 200 ] characters

User-defined name of the DCA Bot. If not specified, the system will generate a default name automatically.

account_id
required
integer

ID of the exchange account entity where you want to create the DCA Bot.

pairs
required
Array of strings (Pairs)

Trading pair(s) in 3Commas format.

max_active_deals
integer [ 1 .. 199 ]
Default: 1

The maximum number of active deals available for this DCA Bot.

strategy
string
Enum: "short" "long"

The type of trading strategy used by this DCA Bot.

profit_currency
string
Enum: "base_currency" "quote_currency"

Currency used for profit calculation: base_currency or quote_currency.

base_order_volume_type
string
Enum: "quote_currency" "base_currency" "percent"

The volume type of the base order.

base_order_volume
string

The volume of the base order for this DCA Bot.

start_order_type
string
Enum: "limit" "market"

The start order type for this DCA Bot.

Array of objects (StrategyConfig)

Array of strategies specifically for opening deals.

leverage_type
string
Enum: "cross" "isolated"

Sets leverage settings for a futures account.

leverage_custom_value
number

Leverage value (exchange- and pair-dependent).

trailing_enabled
boolean

Enables trailing for Take Profit.

trailing_deviation
string

Percentage value of the trailing deviation.

take_profit_type
string
Enum: "base" "total"

Basis for Take Profit calculation.

take_profit
string

Percentage value for the bot’s Take Profit. Set to 0 if using steps.

Array of objects (TakeProfitStep)

Take Profit steps (up to 4), each with:

  • amount_percentage
  • profit_percentage
Array of objects (StrategyConfig)

Array of strategies used for closing deals.

min_profit_type
string
Enum: "base_order_volume" "total_bought_volume"

Basis for minimum profit calculation.

min_profit_percentage
string

Minimum profit percentage required to complete a deal.

reinvesting_percentage
string [ 0 .. 100 ]

Percentage of realized profit to reinvest in each new deal.

stop_loss_percentage
string

Percentage drop to trigger Stop Loss.

stop_loss_type
string
Enum: "stop_loss" "stop_loss_and_disable_bot"

Action after Stop Loss closes a deal.

tsl_enabled
boolean

Enables trailing for Stop Loss.

sl_to_breakeven_enabled
boolean
Default: false

Enables the Move-to-Breakeven feature.

sl_to_breakeven_data
object

Configuration for breakeven trigger levels (0 = entry price, 1 = first TP step, etc.).

stop_loss_timeout_enabled
boolean
Default: false

Enables Stop Loss timeout.

stop_loss_timeout_in_seconds
integer

Timeout duration in seconds for Stop Loss.

risk_reduction_percentage
string

Percentage of losses to reduce base and safety orders proportionally.

safety_order_step_percentage
string

Price deviation (%) to open each safety order.

safety_order_volume_type
string
Enum: "quote_currency" "base_currency" "percent"

Volume type for safety orders.

safety_order_volume
string

Volume of each safety order.

Array of objects (StrategyConfig)

Array of strategies for executing safety orders.

max_safety_orders
integer [ 0 .. 200 ]

Maximum total number of safety orders per deal.

active_safety_orders_count
integer

Number of safety orders the bot may place concurrently.

martingale_volume_coefficient
string [ 0.1 .. 10 ]

Multiplier for increasing safety order volume (Martingale).

martingale_step_coefficient
string [ 0.1 .. 10 ]

Multiplier for increasing safety order step (Martingale).

min_volume_btc_24h
string

Minimum 24h BTC volume required to open a deal.

min_price
number

Minimum price to open a new deal.

max_price
number

Maximum price to open a new deal.

deal_start_delay_seconds
integer

Delay before a new deal starts (seconds).

cooldown
string [ 0 .. 2592000 ]

Time after closing a deal before a new one can start (seconds).

disable_after_deals_count
integer

Number of deals after which the bot disables itself.

allowed_deals_on_same_pair
integer

Max concurrent deals on the same pair (MultiBot only).

min_price_percentage
number [ -95 .. 1000 ]

Minimum entry price percentage (−95 to 1000).

max_price_percentage
number [ -95 .. 1000 ]

Maximum entry price percentage (−95 to 1000).

close_deals_timeout
string >= 60

Auto-close deals after this many seconds.

Responses

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/bots/{bot_id}/update

Get the list of DCA Bots

Returns a list of DCA Bots by user. Use the query parameters to filter the results.

Authorizations:
SIGNED
query Parameters
account_id
integer

Unique 3Commas ID of the exchange account entity. Use the List of connected exchanges and wallets endpoint to retrieve the value for the account_id parameter.

strategy
string
Enum: "long" "short"

Filters bots by trading strategy type.

order_direction
string
Default: "DESC"
Enum: "ASC" "DESC"

Sets the direction of ordering.

limit
integer <= 100
Default: 50

Limits the number of records returned (max 100).

offset
integer >= 0

Skips the first N records in the results.

from
integer

Returns entities created after a specific timestamp (ms since epoch).

scope
string

Filters bots by their status.

sort_by
string
Default: "created_at"
Enum: "created_at" "updated_at" "profit"

Specifies the field used to order the results.

quote

Authorizations:
SIGNED
path Parameters
bot_id
required
integer

Request Body schema: application/json
required

Payload for copying an existing DCA Bot

required
string

The name for the new DCA Bot specified by the user.

secret
required
string

A unique code used for copying this bot, retrieved from the url_secret parameter.

required
number

DCA Bot Deals

The Deal is a sub-entity of the DCA Bot. It represents a single automated transaction executed based on the bot's configured strategy.

The Deal entity holds the following information about:

  • Order type
  • Trading pair(s)
  • Status of the deal
  • Initial and realized trade amounts
  • Initial and realized total values of the trade
  • Price details, including entry, average, and final prices
  • Position percentage reached during the trade
  • Conditions related to trailing mechanisms and triggers (e.g., trailing stop enabled, trigger price)

Deals are created automatically by the DCA Bot based on predefined conditions and the selected trading strategy.

A Deal can include various trading stages or types, depending on the configuration, such as:

  • Initial trade opening
  • Trailing Take Profit execution
  • Stop Loss activation
  • Safety orders placement
  • Final trade closure Here, you can find methods and attributes to monitor, update, or analyze the details of deal.

Get list of deals

Returns the list of deals. Use the query parameters to page through results.

Authorizations:
SIGNED
query Parameters
bot_id
integer

Filters by the unique ID of the 3Commas DCA Bot.

account_id
integer

Unique 3Commas ID of the exchange account entity. Use the List of connected exchanges and wallets endpoint to retrieve the value for the account_id parameter.

limit
integer <= 1000
Default: 50

Limits the number of records returned.

offset
integer >= 0

Skips the first N records in the results.

from
string

Returns entities created after a specific time.

to
string

Returns entities created before a specific time.

scope
string or null
Default: null
Enum: "active" "finished" "completed" "cancelled" "failed"

Filters deals by their status.

order
string
Default: "created_at"
Enum: "created_at" "updated_at" "closed_at" "profit" "profit_percentage"

Specifies the field used to order the results.

order_direction
string
Default: "DESC"
Enum: "ASC" "DESC"

Sets the direction of order: ASC or DESC.

base
string

Filters by base currency.

quote
string

Filters by quote currency.

note
string

Filters deals by note.

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/deals

Update deal

Edits an existing deal of DCA Bot using its ID. Endpoint available for deals in statuses bought and close_strategy_activated.

Authorizations:
SIGNED
path Parameters
deal_id
required
integer

Unique 3Commas deal ID.

Request Body schema: application/json
required
take_profit
number

Percentage value for the bot’s Take Profit. Must be 0 if using multiple take_profit_steps.

Array of objects (TakeProfitStep)

Multiple steps with conditions for Taking Profit in this deal.

profit_currency
string
Enum: "quote_currency" "base_currency"

Currency used to calculate profit (quote_currency or base_currency).

take_profit_type
required
string
Enum: "base" "total"

Take Profit order type for this deal.

trailing_enabled
boolean

Enable trailing for Take Profit.

sl_to_breakeven_enabled
boolean

Enable Move to Breakeven (requires at least two TP steps).

object

Upper limit to which stop loss will move when breakeven is activated.

max_safety_orders
integer [ 0 .. 200 ]

Maximum total number of Safety Orders for this deal.

active_safety_orders_count
integer

Number of Safety Orders placed in advance on the exchange order book.

stop_loss_percentage
number

Percentage drop from TP target to trigger a Stop Loss market order.

stop_loss_timeout_enabled
boolean

Enable timeout before Stop Loss executes.

stop_loss_timeout_in_seconds
integer

Timeout value in seconds; required if stop_loss_timeout_enabled is true.

tsl_enabled
boolean

Enable trailing for Stop Loss.

stop_loss_type
string
Enum: "stop_loss" "stop_loss_and_disable_bot"

Action after Stop Loss triggers.

close_timeout
integer >= 60

Seconds after which the deal will auto-close.

note
string

Optional user-defined note for this deal.

min_profit_percentage
number

Minimum profit percentage required to complete the deal.

Responses

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/deals/{deal_id}/update_deal

Close one step in deal at market price

Closes a specific Trade within the Deal by market using its ID. After this action, the final status Panic_sold will be automatically set by 3Commas.

Authorizations:
SIGNED
path Parameters
deal_id
required
integer

Unique 3Commas ID for this Deal entity.

query Parameters
trade_id
required
integer

Unique 3Commas ID for the Trade entity within the deal that should be sold. Use the Get Deal endpoint to retrieve trade_id values.

Responses

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/deals/{deal_id}/panic_sell_step

Test authentication

The quickest way to test your authentication setup is by sending a request to the /ver1/validate endpoint.
This endpoint verifies the validity of your API credentials and returns the status of your authentication.

Authorizations:
SIGNED

Responses

https://api.3commas.io/public/api/ver1/validate

Response samples

  • 200
  • 400
  • 401
  • 418
  • 429
  • 500
  • 504
Content type
application/json
{
  • "valid": true
}
